alert.note: Alert for San Juan County; Western Whatcom County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 22 at 4:24AM PST until December 23 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 10 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy mixed precipitation possible. Total snow accumulations of up to three inches and ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch possible. * WHERE...San Juan County, including Stuart Island, Waldron Island, Orcas Island, San Juan Island, Lopez Island, Blakely Island, and Decatur Island and Lowlands of western Whatcom County, including Point Roberts, Lummi Island, Bellingham, and Sumas. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 10 PM PST this evening. For the Winter Storm Watch, from this evening through Friday evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...This is will be a complex mix of winter precipitation with potentially significant impacts.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. For sheltering information and other human services in your area, dial 2 1 1 during business hours or visit wa211.org anytime. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: San Juan County; Western Whatcom County
